citeinfo.title: Stream Routes with Strahler Stream Order

descript.abstract: Stream segments with Strahler stream order values assigned. For more information about Strahler stream order, see: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Strahler_Stream_Order Stream order was assigned using an automated process. Data has not been verified and is subject to change. Be sure to check the values before using the layer. Stream order values are maintained as tabular data and displayed as linear events on the Stream Routes with Kittle Numbers and Mile Measures layer. In the attribute table, designated segments extend from the FROM_MEAS (mile) to the TO_MEAS (mile) and have a total length = [LENGTH_MI] on a route with total length = [ROUTE_MI].
descript.purpose: To show Strahler stream order for streams in MN; used to support Fisheries managment activities.
descript.supplinf: State of Minnesota, plus some streams in WI, ND, SD, IA

theme.themekey: Strahler, Streams, Stream Order, 24K Streams, inland waters

citeinfo.title: Stream Routes with Kittle Numbers and Mile Measures

procstep.procdesc: Original source of linear features is MNDOT 1:24K Basemap features (circa 1980's). Considerable editing and attributing of DNR-managed streams has taken place since 2000; attributes have been enhanced to better support DNR business practices. Features have been attributed with DNR Kittle Numbers (unique stream IDs) and mile measures, starting with mile 0 at the mouth and increasing upstream. Mile measures are based on length of linear features, not on field measurements. Many stream features have been re-digitized over time to match current air photos. This dataset contains a collection of "best available features" from multiple sources, and represent various scales and accuracies. Thus, feature accuracy is highly variable and may not accurately reflect real-world conditions. Accuracy of original MNDOT Basemap features: Horizontal positional accuracy is highly variable. Rectilinear features are probably accurate to 55 feet (based on estimated production errors and a mean sum square estimation). Feature representation of sinuous streams is especially variable, with accuracies in the 55 foot range present in some areas, and non-systematic offsets (especially as coarse generalizations) present in other areas of up to 150 feet. Quality typically varies along 7 1/2 quandrangle borders, with the most significant and consistent offsets observed in the northeastern portion of the state, and the best representations found in Southern Minnesota.

enttyp.enttypd: Stream Routes with Strahler Stream Order

attr.attrdef: Unique GIS record number for each stream route feature in DNR Hydrography SDE - Stream Route Centerlines (GIS-calculated.)

Unique Fisheries Watercourse ID for joining/linking stream routes to DNR Fisheries Stream Survey Oracle DB. FW_IDs are assigned based on how the watercourse is managed by DNR Fisheries (an FW_ID may correspond to an entire stream or portion of a stream.) Dummy (invalid) Kittle Numbers have FW_ID = 0.

Watercourse ID per DNR Fisheries Stream Survey database. A valid KITTLE_NBR has a drainage-branching format 'X-000-000-000...' (See VALID = Y, below). A dummy KITTLE_NBR has the format 'MAJXXXX-xxxxx' (See VALID = N, below).
Stream Name per DNR Fisheries Stream Survey database
Length of entire stream route in miles. (GIS-calculated.)
Mile measure for starting (downstream) location of linear feature. (GIS-calculated.)
Mile measure for ending (upstream) location of linear feature. (GIS-calculated.)
Length of linear feature in miles. (GIS-calculated.)
UTM X coordinate for starting location of linear feature. (GIS-calculated.)
UTM Y coordinate for starting location of linear feature. (GIS-calculated.)
UTM X coordinate for ending location of linear feature. (GIS-calculated.)
UTM Y coordinate for ending location of linear feature. (GIS-calculated.)
Unique ID for Stream Order assignment process (placeholder)
Date the GIS layer was published or updated and re-published.
